Henry recruited Scott Lang, a former professional thief to become the new Ant-Man and try to steal the suit from Darren.

Hope van Dyne is the daughter of physicist Hank Pym and Janet van Dyne, and a board member of the company founded by her father, Pym Technologies. After her mother’s disappearance, Hope fell out with her father. She reunited with him only after Darren Cross, the protege and new CEO of Pym Technologies betrayed Hank and tried to sell his new suit to Hydra. Hope helped Hank recruit Scott Lang, a former professional thief to steal the suit back from Darren. After Darren was defeated, Hank finally offered Hope her mother’s Wasp suit, wishing for her to assume her mantle.

Darren Cross is Hank Pym’s protege in Pym Technologies. He betrayed his mentor and took the company from him. He rebranded it  as “Cross Technologies”, and wanted to recreate his mentor’s Pym Particles and sell it to Hydra. He successfully created the Yellowjacket suit but was challenged by Scott Lang, the new Ant-Man. In the ensuing battle, Darren was defeated and killed.

Maggie Lang is the former wife of Ant-Man Scott Lang, and mother of their daughter, Cassandra. When Maggie was still married to Scott, she was supportive of his husband even though she knew of his criminal past. They got divorced after Scott landed himself in prison for stealing from his former company, Vistacorp, even though Maggie warned him against doing it. She eventually remarried.

Cassandra “Cassie” Lang is the daughter of Ant-Man Scott Lang and his wife, Maggie. When she was born, Scott vowed to quit his life of crime but was arrested for stealing from his former company, Vistacorp, a company who stole from their customers. Cassie’s parents divorced while Scott was serving his sentence and Maggie remarried. Cassie still loved his father, Scott, as she loved the doll he gave to her, even though it looked ugly. When the fight between Scott and Darren took place in Cassie’s house, Darren took her hostage. Scott defeated him and rescued his daughter.

Luis is a former cellmate of Ant-Man Scott Lang. After Scott was released from prison, Luis came to pick him up. He proposed a new job, which Scott at first rejected. After Scott took on the job from physicist Hank Pym to steal the Yellowjack suit from Darren Cross, Luis was part of the team that helped Scott. Luis posed as a security guard at Pym Technologies and helped Scott to sneak into the company.

Kurt is a friend of Ant-Man Scott Lang and Luis. When physicist Hank Pym recruited Scott to be the next Ant-Man and help steal the Yellowjacket suit from Darren Cross, Scott brought along his group of buddies to help in the stealing. Kurt worked as the expert hacker in the team, helping Scott hack into the security system of Pym Technologies.

Dave is a friend of Ant-Man Scott Lang and Luis. When physicist Hank Pym recruited Scott to be the next Ant-Man and help steal the Yellowjacket suit from Darren Cross, Scott brought along his group of buddies to help in the stealing. Dave worked as the getaway driver in the team, always ready to make a quick getaway for the team in case anything goes wrong.

Stephen Vincent Strange is a world-renowned neurosurgeon. Brilliant but arrogant, Stephen or Dr Strange cared only about himself. After getting into a severe car accident, Stephen damaged the nerve endings of his fingers which resulted in his hands being practically crippled. After his futile search for a cure in Western medicine, Stephen turned to the Mystic Arts for healing. Told to go to a place called Kamar-Taj in Nepal, he journeyed to the Far East and found the Ancient One. Stephen trained under the Ancient One and Karl Mordo to slowly regain the use of his hands, while also helping his masters fend off an imminent threat of Kaecilius, a former student of the Ancient One who went rogue and tried to merge Earth with the Dark Dimension. After witnessing the death of the Ancient One, Stephen became the new protector of the New York Sanctum, facing off Kaecilius and Dormammu, the ruler of the Dark Dimension with the help of the Eye of Agamotto, which contained the Time Stone. Stephen later helped Thor locate Odin after Loki banished their father to Earth.

Karl Mordo is a former member of the Masters of the Mystic Arts. One of the Ancient One’s best students, Karl helped train the new recruits including Stephen Strange or Dr Strange. During a battle with Kaecilius and his zealots, Karl discovered the truth that the Ancient One had been drawing her powers from the Dark Dimension, which was a forbidden act. This changed Karl’s perspective on the whole situation and felt betrayed by his master. After the death of the Ancient One and the defeat of Dormammu, Karl left his allies at the Masters of the Mystic Arts and went around stripping any magic users of their powers in order to restore balance.

The Ancient One is the leader of a group called the Masters of the Mystic Arts and also the Sorcerer Supreme. She had protected Earth from all kinds of mystical threats for centuries and aided many by teaching the magical arts to those who needed hope. A former student of hers, Kaecilius went rogue and stole a mystical text that allows him to merge Earth with the Dark Dimension. The Ancient One tries to stop him but Kaecilius escaped. Although the Ancient One was reluctant to train Stephen Strange or Dr Strange at first, her student, Karl Mordo, convinced her otherwise. Kaecilius soon revealed the truth to everyone that the Ancient One herself had been drawing her powers from the Dark Dimension but she argued that it was done for the good of others. In a final battle with Kaecilius, the Ancient One succumbed to her injuries and died, passing on the mantle of Sorcerer Supreme to Stephen.

Kaecilius is a powerful sorcerer and a former member of the Masters of the Mystic Arts. He couldn’t understand why his mentor, the Ancient One, refused to allow anyone to tamper with other dimensions although she herself was drawing energy from the Dark Dimension. Kaecilius went rogue and formed the Zealots with the intention to defeat his mentor and unite Earth with the Dark Dimension. Although Kaecilius was successful in killing his mentor, he was challenged by Stephen Strange or Dr Strange who, with the help of the Eye of Agamotto defeated Kaecilius. Kaecilius and his Zealots were absorbed into the Dark Dimension by Dormammu.

Christine Palmer is a surgeon, and a former colleague and girlfriend of Stephen Strange. They broke up due to his egoistic personality, and remained friends and co-workers. After Stephen (Dr Strange) crippled his hand in the car accident, Christine helped him through the ordeal, seeking aid from other doctors. As Stephen’s patience grew thin, he lashed out at Christine and she left him. After a fierce battle with Kaecilius, Strange returned injured to Christine through a portal, and she operated on him, saving his life. Christine later operated on the Ancient One as well, but failed to save her.

Wong is a Master of the Mystic Arts, and also the librarian of Kamar-Taj. When the previous librarian was murdered by Kaecilius when he was obtaining the ancient text, Wong had to step in and take the place of the librarian. Wong assisted Stephen Strange in his studies although he's strict on the usage of the ancient books in the library. When Kaecilius attacked the Hong Kong Sanctum, Wong and some other fellow masters were there to defend the place but they were swiftly defeated. Stephen or Dr Strange made use of the Eye of Agamotto and the Time Stone within to turn back time in order to save Wong’s life.

Jonathan Pangborn is a factory worker. Both his legs were paralysed after an accident at the workplace. He sought healing at the Kamar-Taj and returned home with his legs restored. When Stephen Strange couldn’t get any help from Western medicine, he was told about Jonathan’s miraculous recovery. Stephen or Dr Strange went to find Jonathan who told him to seek the Ancient One in Kamar-Taj, Nepal. After one of the Ancient One’s best students, Karl Mordo, learnt the truth and betrayal of his teacher, he found Jonathan and absorbed his mystical powers, leaving him paralysed once more.

Hamir is an elderly Master of the Mystic Arts who only has one arm. When Stephen Strange first arrived at Kamar-Taj, he mistook Hamir to be the Ancient One just based on the fact that he looked old and wise. When the Ancient One was training Stephen or Dr Strange, he complained to her that his damaged hand was hindering his process of learning magic. Upon hearing this, the Ancient One asked the one-armed Hamir to demonstrate what he could do, showing Stephen that if Hamir can do magic with one arm completely missing, nothing should stop him from performing magic.

Dormammu is an interdimensional being who is also the ruler of the Dark Dimensions. Dormammu convinced Kaecilius to betray his fellow Masters of the Mystic Arts and steal an ancient text that allows him to merge Earth with the Dark Dimension. Kaecilius succeeded in opening the dimensional portal to the Dark Dimension, but before Dormammu could enter Earth, he was confronted by Stephen Strange wielding the Time Stone. Stephen or Dr Strange wanted to strike a bargain with Dormammu, asking him to leave Earth alone or else he will be forever stuck in a time loop. As Dormammu killed Stephen time and time again, he kept coming back like an infinite time loop. Dormammu gave up after many attempts to end Stephen and reluctantly agreed to leave Earth alone. Before the portal closed, Dormammu absorbed Kaecilius and his Zealots into the Dimension.

Peter Parker is a high school student at Midtown School of Science and Technology. After receiving a spider’s bite, he possessed spider-like abilities. He became the neighbourhood friendly Spider-Man. After some of his heroic acts in Queens were captured and shared on social media, Iron Man Tony Stark took notice of the kid and approached Peter for help when he needed reinforcements to find and take in Steve Rogers and Bucky. Tony crafted a new suit for Peter for the fight and allowed him to keep it after. Peter remained a well-known local superhero, but always craved to be an actual Avenger. After discovering a criminal syndicate in Queens selling illegal alien weapons, Peter tried his best to stop them but he’s often stopped by their leader, a man in a wingsuit called who calls himself “Vulture”. Discovering that ‘Vulture” was actually his crush’s father, Peter had to stop him from stealing a batch of Tony’s technology that's being relocated. Only after defeating Vulture did Peter discover the true responsibilities of a hero.

May Parker is Spider-Man Peter Parker’s aunt. She looked after the orphaned Peter as his legal guardian. May was very protective of Peter and often asked people to walk away from trouble instead of helping. She had no idea that her nephew was actually Spider-Man. When Peter had the “Stark internship” with Iron Man Tony Stark, May appeared to be supportive of Peter, although she’s not exactly a big fan of Tony and often felt that the internship might not be what's best for Peter as it left him distracted and tired all the time.

Edward “Ned” Leeds is the best friend of  Spider-Man Peter Parker. He was a high school student at Midtown School of Science and Technology, and also in the school’s decathlon team together with Peter and others like Michelle Jones and Liz Toomes. After discovering the secret identity of his best friend, Edward insisted on assisting Peter on his adventures, wanting to be his “guy in the chair”, the person who helped and gave the hero instructions through a earpiece. Leeds did help Peter to hack and unlock certain functions on his Spider-Man suit, and even distracted other students whenever Peter had to leave to go about his superhero business.

Michelle Jones is a friend of both Spider-Man Peter Parker and Edward Leeds. She was a high school student at Midtown School of Science and Technology and had a strange enjoyment of mocking all her fellow students. Although Michelle kept to herself most of the time, she enjoyed company of and would often appear out of the blue around Peter and Edward. She was also in the school’s decathlon team, together with Peter, Edward and schoolmate Liz Toomes. She became the head of the team after Liz’s departure from the school.

Liz Toomes is a friend of Spider-Man Peter Parker. She was a senior high school student at Midtown School of Science and Technology, and had a crush on Peter and knew that Peter had a crush on her as well. Liz was the head of the decathlon team with members such as Peter, Edward Leeds and Michelle Jones. It was later revealed that Liz’s father was actually Adrian Toomes or “The Vulture” who led a criminal group that sold illegal alien technology to other criminals and Peter had been trying to stop him from doing so. Liz seemed to be unaware of the activities her father was involved in. When Adrian was finally apprehended by Peter, Liz had to leave school and relocate to Oregon as her father didn’t want her to be in New York during his trials

Adrian Toomes is the former owner of Toomes Salvage Company and the father of Liz Toomes. After his livelihood was taken over by the government’s Department of Damage Control, Toomes chose to be a criminal and steal from the government. Recruiting his fellow salvage co-workers such as Phineas Mason, Herman Schultz and Jackson Brice, Toomes donned a flying exosuit created from stolen Chitauri technology and took on the identity of “Vulture”. After his criminal acts were discovered by Spider-Man Peter Parker, Toomes was forced to hunt down and try to take down the young hero. Toomes soon realised that the hero was actually his daughter’s schoolmate, and warned him not to interfere in his affairs anymore or he will kill him. After a battle with Peter, Toomes’ exosuit was badly damaged and he fell into a pile of burning wreckage but was saved by Peter..

Eugene “Flash” Thompson was a high school student at Midtown School of Science and Technology. He was also a member of the school’s decathlon team with Peter Parker and Edward Leeds, but spent most of his time as a backup member. Eugene spent most of this time in school antagonising Peter and Edward especially after finding out from Edward that Peter knew Spider-Man personally. When Spider-Man decided to go after Adrian Toomes or Vulture right before the homecoming dance, he chanced upon Eugene in his car and took the opportunity to “borrow” the car from Eugene to give chase to Toomes.

Aaron Davis, nicknamed “The Prowler”, is a criminal living in Queens, New York. He was seen trying to buy weapons from Jackson Brice and Herman Schutz, two members of the Adrian Toomes criminal organisation. When the weapon turned out to be alien, Davis backed out of the deal, claiming he didn’t want to “send people back in time”. Later on, Spider-Man interrogated him to find out if he knew any information about Toomes organisation. Aaron revealed the time and place of their next deal with another criminal named Mac Gargan and advised Spider-Man to get better at his job, claiming that he had a nephew in the city and didn’t want to see him hurt.

Jackson Brice is a member of Adrian Toomes’ criminal organisation. His primary job was to sell the illegally modified alien weapons that Toomes stole from the government. Brice carried around a gauntlet (modified from Crossbone’s gauntlet) and called himself the Shocker. When a deal with criminal Aaron Davis went awry, and Jackson jeopardised the group by acting childish and reckless, Adrian fired Jackson from the group. When Jackson attempted to blackmail Adrian by threatening to expose the group’s activities to the authorities, he killed Jackson in retaliation. It was by accident, as he just wanted to teach him a lesson, not knowing just how lethal the weapon was.

Herman Schultz is a member of Adrian Toomes’ criminal organisation. After Adrian killed another team member, Jackson Brice, for blackmailing him, Adrian passed Jackson’s gauntlet over to Herman and appointed him the new Shocker. Herman assisted Adrian in his deal with Mac Gargan on the Staten Island Ferry and was defeated easily by Spider-Man. Managing to escape, Herman awaited for Peter to be out of his homecoming dance and ambushed him. He was knocked out by Peter after Edward Leeds picked up Peter’s web shooters, and managed to trap Herman in a series of webs.

Phineas Mason, also known as the Tinkerer, is a member of Adrian Toomes’ criminal organisation and is arguably the most important member of the group. Phineas’ job was to modify the goods stolen by Adrian into advanced weaponry. Due to the interference of Spider-Man, Phineas’ weapons were at risk of getting noticed, even by Iron Man Tony Stark. Adrian was on the verge of shutting down the operations altogether before Phineas convinced him to do a final heist on Tony’s tech that's being relocated.

Mac Gargan is a professional criminal and one of Adrian Toomes’ potential buyers for his modified alien weapons. The deal went smoothly on the Staten Island Ferry before getting interrupted by Spider-Man, which ended up with Mac and his crew getting arrested by the FBI. Incarcerated, Mac sought out the recently jailed Adrian for information about Spider-Man, but he lied that he had no idea who the web-slinger was.

Anne Marie Hoag is the new director of the Department of Damage Control, a department in collaboration with Iron Man Tony Stark that handles all the clean-up operations in the wake of any Avengers activities. The introduction of this department put private salvage companies such as Toomes Salvage Company - belonging to Adrian Toomes - out of business.

Principal Morita is in charge of Midtown School for Science and Technology, the school that Peter Parker and many others are currently in. Morita was the grandchild of the Jim Morita, a member of the Howling Commandos who fought against Hydra in World War II, together with Captain America Steve Rogers.

Erik Killmonger, born N’Jadaka, is a Wakandan prince, son of N’Jobu. As a child, Erik’s father was killed by the king, T’Chaka, for betraying the kingdom of Wakanda by selling them out to black market smuggler Ulysses Klaue. Erik was left in Oakland. Growing up, Erik became an American black-ops soldier and earned the nickname “Killmonger” for his ruthlessness. Manipulating and then killing Ulysses, Erik made his way back to Wakanda where he challenged T’Challa for the rights to the throne. After beating T’Challa in combat and seemingly killing him, Erik donned his new Black Panther suit and assumed the role as king. Frustrated that Wakanda kept its resources to itself and refused help to people of the same race out there who's suffering, Erik got weapons of destruction to these people, in hope that they overthrow their government. T’Challa returned to fight Erik and defeated him.

Nakia is a Wakandan spy, and ex-lover of the king, T’Challa. She is also the warrior representing the River Tribe of Wakanda. Nakia was on an undercover human-trafficking mission in Nigeria before getting rescued by T’Challa and Okoye after the death of T’Chaka. T’Challa wanted Nakia to be present for his coronation to become the new king. When Erik Killmonger defeated and seemingly killed T’Challa, and assumed the role of king, Nakia was one of the only people who defied the new king and escaped Wakanda with Shuri and Ramonda. After discovering that T’Challa was still alive, she healed him with Ramonda and aided T’Challa in the final battle against Killmonger and his forces.

Okoye is the general of the Dora Milaje, a group of highly trained Wakandan women and the head of security in Wakanda’s armed forces. She also served as the personal bodyguard of the king, T’Challa, and barely left his side. Okoye joined T’Challa and Nakia in their mission to South Korea and pursued black market smuggler Ulysses Klaue. When Erik Killmonger defeated and seemingly killed T’Challa, and assumed the role of king, Okoye had no choice but to serve the new king. When T’Challa finally returned to claim his throne, Okoye and her Dora Milaje turned on Killmonger and tried to take him down.

Shuri is the princess of Wakanda, sister to T’Challa and daughter to the king, T’Chaka, and the queen, Ramonda. She is also the leader of the Wakandan Design Group, inventing many of the Vibranium technology used by all of Wakanda. She designed his brother’s new Black Panther suit. After T’Chaka’s death,  Bucky Barnes (Winter Soldier) was left in Wakanda to heal and Shuri was placed in charge to rid him of Hydra’s brainwashing. Shuri assisted T’Challa and his group when they were in South Korea pursuing black market smuggler Ulysses Klaue and also in the final battle against Erik Killmonger and his forces.

Ramonda is the queen of Wakanda, the mother of T’Challa and Shuri, and wife of the king, T’Chaka. After the death of her husband in the UN bombing incident, Ramonda was saddened but welcomed T’Challa back to Wakanda in time for his coronation to become the next king.When Erik Killmonger defeated and seemingly killed T’Challa, and assumed the role of king, Ramonda escaped Wakanda with her daughter and Nakia, and sought help from the Jabari tribe. When they found out that T’Challa was still alive, Ramonda and Nakia healed him.

W’Kabi is T’Challa’s best friend and also the warrior for the Border Tribe of Wakanda. It is also implied that he’s the lover of Okoye, general of the Dora Milaje. W’Kabi’s parents were killed by black market smuggler Ulysses Klaue when he was attempting to escape Wakanda years ago, so when W’Kabi found out that T’Challa failed in the pursuit of Ulysses in South Korea, he turned his back on his best friend. W’Kabi allowed Erik Killmonger into Wakanda, supporting him in taking the throne of T’Challa. In the final battle between T’Challa and Erik, W’Kabi led the Wakandan forces and War Rhinos against his former best friend and only surrendered in the end, after his War Rhino refused to attack Okoye.

M’Baku is the warrior and leader of the Jabari Tribe, a group of Wakandan who removed themselves from the other four tribes of Wakanda. When T’Chaka died, T’Challa was set to be crowned King but the tribes were allowed to challenge T’Challa for a chance to the throne. When no one else stepped up for the challenge, M’Baku challenged him. M’Baku was defeated in combat and retreated to the mountains. Later, When Erik Killmonger defeated and seemingly killed T’Challa, and assumed the role of king, T’Challa’s body was found by a Jabari fisherman and brought to M’Baku. He preserved T’Challa’s body in ice and led Nakia, Ramonda and Shuri to him for healing. Although refusing to help at first, M’Baku eventually led his Jabari forces in the final battle against Erik’s forces in Wakanda.

Zuri is a Wakandan Shaman and the advisor to the King. Once a Wakandan spy for the king, T’Chaka, to watch the prince, N’Jobu, Zuri notified T’Chaka about N’Jobu’s treason against Wakanda. When N’Jobu found about Zuri’s betrayal, he tried to kill Zuri, resulting in his own death in the hands of his brother, T’Chaka. When N’Jobu’s son, Erik Killmonger challenged T’Challa for the throne, Zuri confessed that he was the reason Erik’s father was killed. Erik killed Zuri by stabbing him with his blade.

N’Jobu is the prince of Wakanda, brother to the king, T’Chaka, and father of Erik Killmonger. Frustrated that Wakanda kept its resources to itself and refused help to people of the same race out there who's suffering, N’Jobu helped a black market smuggler, Ulysses Klaue, steal Vibranium material from Wakanda. Notified about his brother’s treachery, T’Chaka confronted N’Jobu at his apartment in Oakland, but before he could take N’Jobu back to Wakanda for trial, N’Jobu tried to kill Zuri, a spy planted by T’Chaka to watch N’Jobu. T’Chaka retaliated and killed N’Jobu.

The Mining Tribe Elder is a member of the Wakandan Tribal Council, and the leader of the Mining Tribe. Being one of the five original Wakandan Tribe, each elder is allowed to send a warrior to represent their tribe to challenge the would-be king during the coronation. The Mining Tribe Elder and her tribe chose not to challenge T’Challa.

The Border Tribe Elder is a member of the Wakandan Tribal Council, and the leader of the Border Tribe. Being one of the five original Wakandan Tribe, each elder is allowed to send a warrior to represent their tribe to challenge the would-be king during the coronation. The Border Tribe’s warrior is T’Challa’s best friend, W’Kabi, but the Border Tribe Elder and his tribe chose not to challenge T’Challa.

The River Tribe Elder is a member of the Wakandan Tribal Council, and the leader of the River Tribe. Being one of the five original Wakandan Tribe, each elder is allowed to send a warrior to represent their tribe to challenge the would-be king during the coronation. The River Tribe’s warrior is T’Challa’s ex-lover, Nakia, but the River Tribe Elder and his tribe chose not to challenge T’Challa.

The Merchant Tribe Elder is a member of the Wakandan Tribal Council, and the leader of the Merchant Tribe. Being one of the five original Wakandan Tribe, each elder is allowed to send a warrior to represent their tribe to challenge the would-be King during the coronation. The Merchant Tribe Elder and her tribe chose not to challenge T’Challa.

Proxima Midnight is one of the children of Thanos. Proxima and three other children, Corvus Glaive, The Ebony Maw and Cull Obsidian has been tasked by Thanos to retrieve the Infinity Stones from the Avengers.

Corvus Glaive is one of the children of Thanos. Corvus and three other children, Proxima Midnight, Ebony Maw and Cull Obsidian had been tasked by Thanos to retrieve the Infinity Stones from the Avengers.

Ebony Maw is one of the children of Thanos. Maw and three other children, Corvus Glaive, Proxima Midnight and Cull Obsidian has been tasked by Thanos to retrieve the Infinity Stones from the Avengers.

Cull Obsidian is one of the children of Thanos. Obsidian and three other children, Corvus Glaive, Ebony Maw and Proxima Midnight has been tasked by Thanos to retrieve the Infinity Stones from the Avengers.

Outriders are a species of four-armed alien that form Thanos’s invasion army.  Together with Thanos’s four children, Proxima Midnight, Corvus Glaive, Ebony Maw and Cull Obsidian, the Outriders have been tasked by Thanos to retrieve the Infinity Stones from the Avengers.

Betty Brant is a friend of Spider-Man Peter Parker and best friend with Liz Toomes. She was a high school student at Midtown School of Science and Technology. Betty was also the news anchor on the school’s news programme.

Stan Lee is one of the creators/writers of the Marvel Universe. Stan has appeared in every single Marvel Cinematic Universe movie so far in cameo roles. It was revealed in Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 that the characters he played in the cameo roles are actually the same person, who served as an informant for a cosmic being called the Watcher.

Iron Man tells the story of Tony Stark, a billionaire industrialist and genius inventor who is kidnapped and forced to build a devastating weapon. Instead, using his intelligence and ingenuity, Tony builds a high-tech suit of armour and escapes captivity. When he uncovers a nefarious plot with global implications, he dons his powerful armor and vows to protect the world as Iron Man.

The Incredible Hulk tells the story of Bruce Banner, brilliant biochemist who, after a freak accident, is now living in the shadows, cut off from the life he knew and the woman he loves. Banner struggles to avoid capture and to keep the unbridled force of rage within him at bay. One scientist must make an agonising choice: Accept a peaceful life as Bruce or find heroism in the creature he holds inside - The Hulk.

Iron Man 2 follows Tony Stark, billionaire inventor and superhero who must now face a new threat with the grudge against the Stark family. As the Iron Man discovers that the arc reactor that is keeping him alive is also poisoning him, it’s a race against time to find a solution before it’s too lat

Thor tells the story of a powerful but arrogant warrior whose reckless actions reignite an ancient war. Thor is cast down to Earth and forced to live among humans as punishment. Once here, Thor learns what it takes to be a true hero when the most dangerous villain of his world sends the darkest forces of Asgard to invade Earth.

Captain America: The First Avenger focuses on the early days of the Marvel Universe when Steve Rogers volunteers to participate in an experimental programme that turns him into the Super Soldier known as Captain America, in order to stop Hydra, a secret organisation that’s hell-bent on taking control of the world.

Marvel's The Avengers brings together the team-up of a lifetime, featuring iconic Marvel superheroes Iron Man, the Incredible Hulk, Thor, Captain America, Hawkeye and Black Widow. When an unexpected enemy emerges that threatens global safety and security, Nick Fury, director of the international peacekeeping agency known as S.H.I.E.L.D, finds himself in need of a team to pull the world back from the brink of disaster.

Iron Man 3 pits the brash but brilliant industrialist Tony Stark against an enemy whose reach knows no bounds. When the Iron Man finds his personal world destroyed at his enemy's hands, he embarks on a harrowing quest to find those responsible. This journey, at every turn, will test his mettle. With his back against the wall, Tony is left to survive by his own devices, relying on his ingenuity and instincts to protect those closest to him. As he fights his way back, Tony discovers the answer to the question that has secretly haunted him: Does the man make the suit or does the suit make the man.

Thor: The Dark World continues the big screen adventures of Thor, the Mighty Avenger, as he battles to save Earth and all the Nine Realms from a shadowy enemy that predates the universe itself. In the aftermath of Marvel's "Thor" and "Marvel's The Avengers" Thor fights to restore order across the cosmos. But an ancient race led by the vengeful Malekith returns to plunge the universe back into darkness. Faced with an enemy that even Odin and Asgard cannot withstand, Thor must embark on his most perilous and personal journey yet, one that will reunite him with Jane Foster and force him to sacrifice everything to save the world.

Captain America: The Winter Soldier finds Steve Rogers living quietly in Washington, DC and trying to adjust to the modern world. But when a S.H.I.E.L.D. colleague comes under attack, Steve becomes embroiled in a web of intrigue that threatens to put the world at risk. Joining forces with the Black Widow, Captain America struggles to expose the ever-widening conspiracy while fighting off professional assassins sent to silence him at every turn. When the full scope of the villainous plot is revealed, Captain America and the Black Widow enlist the help of a new ally, the Falcon. However, they soon find themselves up against an unexpected and formidable enemy - the Winter Soldier.

Guardians of the Galaxy expands the Marvel Cinematic Universe into the cosmos, where brash adventurer Peter Quill finds himself the object of an unrelenting bounty hunt after stealing a mysterious orb coveted by Ronan, a powerful villain with ambitions that threaten the entire universe. To evade the ever-persistent Ronan, Quill is forced into an uneasy truce with a quartet of disparate misfits - Rocket, a gun-toting raccoon; Groot, a tree-like humanoid; the deadly and enigmatic Gamora; and the revenge-driven Drax the Destroyer. But when Quill discovers the true power of the orb and the menace it poses to the cosmos, he must do his best to rally his ragtag rivals for a last, desperate stand - with the galaxy's fate in the balance.

Avengers: Age of Ultron is the epic follow-up to the biggest superhero movie of all time. When Iron Man Tony Stark tries to jumpstart a dormant peacekeeping programme, things go awry and Earth's mightiest heroes, including Iron Man, Captain America, Thor, The Incredible Hulk, Black Widow and Hawkeye, are put to the ultimate test as the fate of the planet hangs in the balance. As villainous Ultron emerges, it is up to The Avengers to stop him from enacting his terrible plans, and soon, uneasy alliances and unexpected action pave the way for an epic and unique global adventure.

Ant-Man bookends the Marvel phase two films. Armed with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, master thief Scott Lang must embrace his inner-hero and help his mentor, Hank Pym, protect the secret behind his spectacular Ant-Man suit from a new generation of towering threats. Against seemingly insurmountable obstacles, Hank and Scott must plan and pull off a heist that will save the world.

Captain America: Civil War finds Steve Rogers leading the newly formed team of Avengers in their continued efforts to safeguard humanity. But after another incident involving the Avengers results in collateral damage, political pressure mounts to install a system of accountability, headed by a governing body to oversee and direct the team. The new status quo fractures the Avengers, resulting in two camps - one led by Captain America Steve Rogers and his desire for the Avengers to remain free to defend humanity without government interference, and the other following Iron Man Tony Stark’s surprising decision to support government oversight and accountability.

Doctor Strange tells the story of world-famous neurosurgeon Dr Stephen Strange whose life changes forever after a horrific car accident robs him of the use of his hands. When traditional medicine fails him, he is forced to look for healing, and hope, in an unlikely place - a mysterious enclave known as Kamar-Taj. He quickly learns that this is not just a centre for healing but also the front line of a battle against unseen dark forces bent on destroying our reality. Before long Strange - armed with newly acquired magical powers - is forced to choose whether to return to his life of fortune and status, or leave it all behind to defend the world as the most powerful sorcerer in existence.

Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 continues the team’s adventures as they traverse the outer reaches of the cosmos. The Guardians must fight to keep their newfound family together as they unravel the mystery of Peter Quill’s true parentage. Old foes become new allies and fan-favourite characters from the classic comics will come to our heroes’ aid as the Marvel Cinematic Universe continues to expand.

Spider-Man: Homecoming follows a young Peter Parker/Spider-Man, who made his sensational debut in Captain America: Civil War, begins to navigate his newfound identity as the web-slinging superhero. Thrilled by his experience with the Avengers, Peter returns home, where he lives with his Aunt May, under the watchful eye of his new mentor, Tony Stark. Peter tries to fall back into his normal daily routine - distracted by thoughts of proving himself to be more than just your friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man - but when the Vulture emerges as a new villain, everything that Peter holds most important will be threatened.

Thor: Ragnarok finds our hero imprisoned on the other side of the universe without his mighty hammer. Thor is in a race against time to get back to Asgard to stop Ragnarok - the destruction of his homeworld and the end of Asgardian civilisation - at the hands of an all-powerful new threat, the ruthless Hela. But first, he must survive a deadly gladiatorial contest that pits him against his former ally and fellow Avenger - the Incredible Hulk.

Black Panther follows T’Challa who - after the death of his father, the king of Wakanda - returns home to the isolated, technologically advanced African nation to succeed to the throne and take his rightful place as king. But when a powerful old enemy reappears, T’Challa’s mettle as king - and Black Panther - is tested when he is drawn into a formidable conflict that puts the fate of Wakanda and the entire world at risk. Faced with treachery and danger, the young king must rally his allies and release the full power of Black Panther to defeat his foes and secure the safety of his people and their way of life.
